duties_responsibilities.duty: Specialize in the installation and basic repair of aftermarket tire and wheel service equipment.
Advise customers with application questions involving the use of equipment including proper techniques and accessory usage.
Conduct installation and removal of tire and wheel service equipment.
Conduct product training and demonstration during installation of new equipment to end-users.
Conduct the billing and collection for services rendered, including processing invoices as well as collecting cash, checks, and other forms of payment.
Manage parts inventory and perform a cycle count of inventory in defined time periods.
Interact with customers, shop managers, automotive technicians, and other members of the tire and wheel services industry.
Interact with various employees of the company, especially employees of the field service, customer service, and finance departments.
Perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

education_certification.credential: High School Diploma or equivalent (Technical degree in a related field preferred)
